title: 2 Peter Chapter 1 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Peter chapter 1 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Peter Chapter 1 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Peter Chapter 1.

questions.question: Who is the author of the letter in 2 Peter 1:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Simon Peter
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 1:1 identifies the author as Simon Peter, a servant and apostle of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 1:2, what is multiplied unto the readers through the knowledge of God and Jesus our Lord?
questions.correctAnswer: Grace and peace
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 1:2 says grace and peace are multiplied unto you through the knowledge of God and Jesus our Lord.

questions.question: What has God's divine power given us according to 2 Peter 1:3?
options: All things that pertain unto life and godliness
questions.correctAnswer: All things that pertain unto life and godliness
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 1:3 teaches that God's divine power has given us all things that pertain unto life and godliness.

questions.question: In 2 Peter 1:4, what are believers promised to become partakers of by the great and precious promises?
questions.correctAnswer: The divine nature
questions.explanation: Verse 4 states believers become partakers of the divine nature through the great and precious promises.

questions.question: Which quality is to be added to faith first according to 2 Peter 1:5?
questions.correctAnswer: Virtue
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 1:5 instructs to add virtue to your faith first.

questions.question: What comes after knowledge in the list of qualities to add in 2 Peter 1:6?
questions.correctAnswer: Temperance
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 1:6 states that temperance comes after knowledge.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 1:7, what follows godliness in the qualities to add?
questions.correctAnswer: Brotherly kindness
questions.explanation: Verse 7 says to add brotherly kindness to godliness.

questions.question: What results if these qualities abound in you, according to 2 Peter 1:8?
options: You will neither be barren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of Jesus Christ
You will be free from all troubles
questions.correctAnswer: You will neither be barren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 1:8 explains that abounding in these qualities prevents you from being barren or unfruitful in Jesus' knowledge.

questions.question: What is said about one who lacks these qualities in 2 Peter 1:9?
options: He is blind and cannot see afar off
questions.correctAnswer: He is blind and cannot see afar off
questions.explanation: Verse 9 states that one lacking these qualities is blind and cannot see afar off.

questions.question: What should believers do to make their calling and election sure, according to 2 Peter 1:10?
options: Give diligence to do these things
questions.correctAnswer: Give diligence to do these things
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 1:10 urges believers to give diligence to do these things to make their calling and election sure.

questions.question: What will be ministered to those who do these things, as stated in 2 Peter 1:11?
options: An entrance abundantly into the everlasting kingdom of Jesus Christ
Peace and joy in this life
questions.correctAnswer: An entrance abundantly into the everlasting kingdom of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 11 promises an abundant entrance into the everlasting kingdom for those who do these things.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Peter 1:14 says Peter knows he will soon die, as Jesus showed him.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 1:14 states Peter knows he must shortly put off his tabernacle, as Jesus showed him.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Peter 1:16, Peter and others followed cunningly devised fables when making known the coming of Jesus Christ.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 1:16 clearly denies following cunningly devised fables and emphasizes eyewitness testimony.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Peter 1:21 states that prophecy came by the will of man.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 21 says prophecy did not come by the will of man but by men moved by the Holy Ghost.

questions.question: Complete the verse from 2 Peter 1:19: 'We have also a more sure word of prophecy; whereunto ye do well that ye take heed, as unto a light that shineth in a ______ place.'
questions.correctAnswer: dark
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 1:19 uses the phrase 'light that shineth in a dark place' to describe the word of prophecy.

medium.title: 2 Peter Chapter 1 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Peter Chapter 1 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with feelings of spiritual barrenness. Based on 2 Peter 1, what qualities should you encourage them to cultivate to be fruitful in the knowledge of Jesus Christ?
options: Faith, virtue, knowledge, temperance, patience, godliness, brotherly kindness, charity
Faith, wealth, power, fame, knowledge, patience, kindness, charity
Faith, knowledge, self-confidence, temperance, patience, honesty, kindness, generosity
Faith, humility, knowledge, temperance, anger, patience, kindness, love
questions.correctAnswer: Faith, virtue, knowledge, temperance, patience, godliness, brotherly kindness, charity
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 1:5-7 teaches that adding these qualities to faith results in fruitfulness in the knowledge of Jesus Christ as stated in verse 8.

questions.question: How does 2 Peter 1 describe the source of all things that pertain to life and godliness?
options: Through the knowledge of God who called us to glory and virtue
Through human effort and good intentions
questions.correctAnswer: Through the knowledge of God who called us to glory and virtue
questions.explanation: Verse 3 explains that God's divine power has given us all things through the knowledge of Him who called us to glory and virtue.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'exceeding great and precious promises' given to believers according to 2 Peter 1?
options: So that we might partake of the divine nature and escape corruption
So that we can gain worldly success and honor
So that we can avoid all suffering
So that we can dominate others
questions.correctAnswer: So that we might partake of the divine nature and escape corruption
questions.explanation: Verse 4 states these promises enable believers to share in the divine nature and escape worldly corruption caused by lust.

questions.question: A believer feels forgetful about their salvation and struggles with assurance. What does 2 Peter 1 teach about those who lack diligence in spiritual growth?
options: They are blind, cannot see afar off, and have forgotten that they were purged from old sins
They are chosen and will be saved regardless
They are still loved but not accountable
questions.correctAnswer: They are blind, cannot see afar off, and have forgotten that they were purged from old sins
questions.explanation: Verse 9 describes those lacking these qualities as blind and forgetful of their cleansing from past sins.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 1, what should believers do to make their calling and election sure?
options: Give diligence to add the qualities taught and do these things
Rely on feelings and experiences alone
Ignore spiritual growth and focus on rituals
questions.correctAnswer: Give diligence to add the qualities taught and do these things
questions.explanation: Verse 10 advises believers to be diligent in practicing these qualities to confirm their calling and election.

questions.question: What does 2 Peter 1 promise to those who diligently practice these virtues?
options: An abundant entrance into the everlasting kingdom of Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: An abundant entrance into the everlasting kingdom of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 11 promises that diligent practice will result in abundant entrance into Christ's eternal kingdom.

questions.question: Why does Peter say he will continue to remind the believers of these truths, even though they already know them?
options: To keep them established in the present truth and to stir them up
Because they are forgetful and need constant correction
To increase his own status among them
Because new doctrines are being introduced
questions.correctAnswer: To keep them established in the present truth and to stir them up
questions.explanation: Verses 12-13 show Peter's intent to keep believers grounded and motivated by reminding them of these truths.

questions.question: How does 2 Peter 1 describe the testimony about Jesus Christ's majesty?
options: As eyewitnesses of His majesty and the voice from heaven
As a myth passed down orally
As a private interpretation of scripture
questions.correctAnswer: As eyewitnesses of His majesty and the voice from heaven
questions.explanation: Verses 16-18 describe the apostles as eyewitnesses to Jesus' majesty and the heavenly voice confirming His Sonship.

questions.question: What is the 'more sure word of prophecy' mentioned in 2 Peter 1, and how should believers regard it?
options: The prophetic scripture, which believers should heed as a light in a dark place
questions.correctAnswer: The prophetic scripture, which believers should heed as a light in a dark place
questions.explanation: Verse 19 encourages believers to pay attention to prophecy in scripture as a guiding light until the full revelation of Christ.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 1, what is the origin of prophecy in scripture?
options: Holy men of God spoke as they were moved by the Holy Spirit
It was invented by religious leaders
It is based on private interpretation
questions.correctAnswer: Holy men of God spoke as they were moved by the Holy Spirit
questions.explanation: Verse 21 states that prophecy did not come by human will but through men moved by the Holy Spirit.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Peter 1, believers receive grace and peace through the knowledge of God and Jesus our Lord.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 2 clearly states that grace and peace are multiplied through the knowledge of God and Jesus.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Peter 1 teaches that prophecy is subject to private interpretation and human will.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 20 clarifies that no prophecy of scripture is of private interpretation, and verse 21 says prophecy came by the Holy Spirit, not human will.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 2 Peter 1 says God has given us all things that pertain unto ___ and godliness through the knowledge of Him.
questions.correctAnswer: life
questions.explanation: Verse 3 teaches that God's divine power has given us all things that pertain unto life and godliness through knowledge of Him.

questions.question: A believer is tempted by worldly desires and struggles to maintain purity. What encouragement does 2 Peter 1 offer about escaping corruption?
options: By partaking of the divine nature through God's promises, escaping corruption caused by lust
By relying on their own strength alone
questions.correctAnswer: By partaking of the divine nature through God's promises, escaping corruption caused by lust
questions.explanation: Verse 4 explains that the promises of God enable believers to partake of the divine nature and escape worldly corruption through lust.

questions.question: How does 2 Peter 1 emphasize the reliability of the apostles' message about Jesus Christ's coming?
options: They were eyewitnesses of His majesty, not following cunningly devised fables
They made up stories to encourage believers
They only believed in private interpretations
questions.correctAnswer: They were eyewitnesses of His majesty, not following cunningly devised fables
questions.explanation: Verse 16 emphasizes that the apostles' testimony is based on their eyewitness experience, not on cleverly invented stories.

hard.title: 2 Peter Chapter 1 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Peter Chapter 1.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 1:3, by what means has God given us all things that pertain unto life and godliness?
options: Through the knowledge of Him who called us to glory and virtue
Through the law given to Moses
By the works of the flesh
questions.correctAnswer: Through the knowledge of Him who called us to glory and virtue
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 1:3 states that divine power has given us all things through the knowledge of Him who called us to glory and virtue, emphasizing the importance of knowing God.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'exceeding great and precious promises' mentioned in 2 Peter 1:4?
options: They enable believers to be partakers of the divine nature and escape worldly corruption
They guarantee earthly wealth and power
They refer to the Old Testament ceremonial laws
They are promises made only to the apostles
questions.correctAnswer: They enable believers to be partakers of the divine nature and escape worldly corruption
questions.explanation: Verse 4 explains that these promises allow believers to partake in the divine nature and escape corruption caused by lust in the world.

questions.question: In 2 Peter 1:5-7, Peter lists a sequence of qualities to add to faith. Which of the following correctly represents the order given?
options: Virtue, Knowledge, Temperance, Patience, Godliness, Brotherly Kindness, Charity
Knowledge, Virtue, Patience, Temperance, Charity, Brotherly Kindness, Godliness
Faith, Hope, Charity, Patience, Temperance, Knowledge, Godliness
Virtue, Temperance, Knowledge, Patience, Charity, Brotherly Kindness, Godliness
questions.correctAnswer: Virtue, Knowledge, Temperance, Patience, Godliness, Brotherly Kindness, Charity
questions.explanation: The passage in verses 5-7 specifically lists these qualities in this order as additions to faith.

questions.question: What does 2 Peter 1:9 say about a person who lacks the qualities listed earlier in the chapter?
options: He is blind, cannot see afar off, and has forgotten his purification from sins
He will be immediately condemned without hope
He will be exalted among men
He is considered more righteous than others
questions.correctAnswer: He is blind, cannot see afar off, and has forgotten his purification from sins
questions.explanation: Verse 9 describes such a person as blind and forgetful of their cleansing from past sins, highlighting spiritual negligence.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 1:10, what should believers do to make their calling and election sure?
options: Give diligence to add the listed qualities to their faith
Follow the teachings of the Pharisees
questions.correctAnswer: Give diligence to add the listed qualities to their faith
questions.explanation: The verse encourages believers to diligently cultivate the virtues to confirm their calling and election.

questions.question: What reward does 2 Peter 1:11 promise for those who confirm their calling and election?
options: Abundant entrance into the everlasting kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Abundant entrance into the everlasting kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: The verse clearly states that such individuals will be granted abundant entrance into the eternal kingdom.

questions.question: In 2 Peter 1:16, Peter rejects the idea that they followed what kind of stories when declaring the power and coming of Christ?
questions.correctAnswer: Cunningly devised fables
questions.explanation: Peter emphasizes that their testimony about Jesus was not based on fabricated stories but on eyewitness experience.

questions.question: What event does 2 Peter 1:17-18 describe that confirms Jesus' divine sonship?
options: A voice from heaven declaring 'This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased' heard on the holy mount
Jesus' baptism by John the Baptist
The feeding of the five thousand
questions.correctAnswer: A voice from heaven declaring 'This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased' heard on the holy mount
questions.explanation: These verses recount the divine voice witnessed on the holy mount affirming Jesus as God's Son.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 1:19, what is described as 'a more sure word of prophecy'?
options: The prophetic scripture which serves as a light in a dark place until the day dawns
The oral traditions of the apostles
The visions given to the Old Testament prophets
questions.correctAnswer: The prophetic scripture which serves as a light in a dark place until the day dawns
questions.explanation: Peter points to prophetic scripture as a reliable light guiding believers until Christ's return.

questions.question: What does 2 Peter 1:20 teach about the interpretation of prophecy in scripture?
options: No prophecy is of private interpretation
Prophecy is open to any individual interpretation
Prophecy is only for priests to interpret
Prophecy is symbolic and not literal
questions.correctAnswer: No prophecy is of private interpretation
questions.explanation: The verse emphasizes that scripture prophecy is not subject to personal or private interpretation but guided by divine inspiration.

questions.question: How were the holy men of God able to speak prophecy according to 2 Peter 1:21?
options: They were moved by the Holy Ghost
By their own will and reasoning
questions.correctAnswer: They were moved by the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: The verse states that prophecy came as holy men spoke under the influence of the Holy Spirit, not by human will.

questions.question: What does Peter mean by 'tabernacle' in 2 Peter 1:13-14, especially in the context of ancient Near Eastern culture?
options: His earthly body or physical life
A place of worship in Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: His earthly body or physical life
questions.explanation: Peter uses 'tabernacle' metaphorically for his mortal body, reflecting ancient imagery of the body as a temporary dwelling.

questions.question: True or False: In 2 Peter 1:2, the multiplication of grace and peace comes through the knowledge of God and Jesus our Lord.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 2 explicitly states that grace and peace are multiplied through the knowledge of God and Jesus Christ.

questions.question: What literary device is evident in the sequence of virtues listed in 2 Peter 1:5-7, progressing from faith to charity?
options: An ascending ladder of spiritual growth (progressive parallelism)
questions.correctAnswer: An ascending ladder of spiritual growth (progressive parallelism)
questions.explanation: The list shows a structured, progressive development of Christian character, typical of progressive parallelism.

questions.question: How does 2 Peter 1:16-18's eyewitness testimony serve as a counterpoint to certain contemporary teachings in the early church?
options: It counters false teachings by affirming the reality of Jesus' majesty witnessed firsthand
It supports Gnostic myths about Jesus' nature
It denies the physical resurrection of Jesus
It promotes reliance on secret knowledge instead of public testimony
questions.correctAnswer: It counters false teachings by affirming the reality of Jesus' majesty witnessed firsthand
questions.explanation: Peter stresses the apostles' eyewitness experience to refute cunningly devised fables and false doctrines.

theological.title: 2 Peter Chapter 1 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Peter Chapter 1 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 1:1, through what means have believers obtained like precious faith?
options: Through the righteousness of God and our Saviour Jesus Christ
Through the works of the law
By their own merits and efforts
questions.correctAnswer: Through the righteousness of God and our Saviour Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 1:1 clearly states that believers have obtained like precious faith through the righteousness of God and our Saviour Jesus Christ. This aligns with Romans 3:22 which speaks of righteousness through faith in Jesus Christ, and also with Philippians 3:9 emphasizing righteousness apart from works.

questions.question: What two blessings does Peter pray to be multiplied to believers through the knowledge of God and Jesus in 2 Peter 1:2?
questions.correctAnswer: Grace and peace
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 1:2 prays for grace and peace to be multiplied through the knowledge of God and Jesus. This parallels greetings in Pauline epistles such as Romans 1:7 and 1 Corinthians 1:3, emphasizing grace and peace as foundational blessings for believers.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 1:3, what has God's divine power given to believers?
options: All things that pertain unto life and godliness
questions.correctAnswer: All things that pertain unto life and godliness
questions.explanation: Verse 3 teaches that God's divine power has provided all that relates to life and godliness, showing God's sufficiency for sanctification. This is consistent with Ephesians 2:8-10 and 2 Corinthians 3:5-6 which emphasize God's power and provision for spiritual growth.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'exceeding great and precious promises' given to believers, according to 2 Peter 1:4?
options: That believers might be partakers of the divine nature
That they might gain earthly riches
questions.correctAnswer: That believers might be partakers of the divine nature
questions.explanation: 2 Peter 1:4 states these promises enable believers to partake in the divine nature, escaping worldly corruption. This theme of participation in God's nature is echoed in John 1:12-13 and Romans 8:29, emphasizing sanctification and transformation.

questions.question: In 2 Peter 1:5-7, Peter lists qualities to add to faith. What is the correct order of these qualities?
options: Virtue, knowledge, temperance, patience, godliness, brotherly kindness, charity
Knowledge, courage, humility, faith, love, joy, peace
Faith, hope, love, joy, patience, kindness, gentleness
Wisdom, understanding, counsel, might, knowledge, fear of the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: Virtue, knowledge, temperance, patience, godliness, brotherly kindness, charity
questions.explanation: Verses 5-7 present this specific sequence of qualities to be added to faith for spiritual maturity. This progression reflects growing Christian character, similar to Galatians 5:22-23 (fruit of the Spirit) and Colossians 3:12-14.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 1:8, what effect do these qualities have when they abound in believers?
options: They make believers neither barren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: They make believers neither barren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 8 explains that the abundance of these virtues results in fruitful knowledge of Christ, reflecting spiritual productivity. This is consistent with John 15:5 on bearing fruit and James 2:17 on faith evidenced by works.

questions.question: What does Peter say about those who lack these qualities in 2 Peter 1:9?
options: They are blind, cannot see afar off, and have forgotten their purification from sins
They will inherit the kingdom without fail
questions.correctAnswer: They are blind, cannot see afar off, and have forgotten their purification from sins
questions.explanation: Verse 9 describes a lack of these virtues as spiritual blindness and forgetting the cleansing from past sins. This is parallel to Hebrews 10:26-29 warning against neglecting salvation and Isaiah 59:10 on spiritual blindness.

questions.question: What does Peter urge believers to do in order to make their calling and election sure, according to 2 Peter 1:10?
options: Give diligence to add these virtues to their faith
Rely solely on their initial faith
questions.correctAnswer: Give diligence to add these virtues to their faith
questions.explanation: Verse 10 exhorts believers to diligently cultivate these qualities to confirm their calling and election. This reflects 1 Timothy 6:11-12's call to pursue godliness and confirm one's faith through perseverance.

questions.question: What promise is given in 2 Peter 1:11 for those who diligently practice these virtues?
options: An abundant entrance into the everlasting kingdom of Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: An abundant entrance into the everlasting kingdom of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 11 promises an abundant entrance into the eternal kingdom for those who practice these virtues, aligning with passages such as Matthew 25:21 on reward and 1 Corinthians 15:50-58 on the final inheritance.

questions.question: In 2 Peter 1:16, Peter claims their testimony about Jesus was not from cunningly devised fables but from what?
questions.correctAnswer: Eyewitnesses of His majesty
questions.explanation: Verse 16 emphasizes that their message is based on direct eyewitness experience of Jesus’ majesty, countering false teachings. This corresponds with Luke 1:2 and Acts 1:21-22 which affirm eyewitness testimony as the foundation of apostolic teaching.

questions.question: What divine affirmation about Jesus does Peter recount hearing on the holy mount in 2 Peter 1:17?
options: 'This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased'
questions.correctAnswer: 'This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased'
questions.explanation: Verse 17 quotes God's voice affirming Jesus as His beloved Son, echoing the Transfiguration event (Matthew 17:5) and affirming Christ’s divine Sonship and approval, foundational for Christology.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 1:19, how is the prophetic word described?
options: A more sure word of prophecy, like a light shining in a dark place
questions.correctAnswer: A more sure word of prophecy, like a light shining in a dark place
questions.explanation: Verse 19 describes prophecy as a sure, illuminating word guiding believers until the day dawns, paralleling Isaiah 9:2 and Psalm 119:105 about the Word as light in darkness.

questions.question: What does 2 Peter 1:20 say about the origin of prophecy in Scripture?
options: No prophecy of Scripture is of private interpretation
All prophecy is subject to personal opinion
questions.correctAnswer: No prophecy of Scripture is of private interpretation
questions.explanation: Verse 20 establishes that Scripture’s prophecy does not stem from private interpretation but divine inspiration, consistent with 2 Timothy 3:16 and Isaiah 55:11 emphasizing God's sovereign origin of prophecy.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 1:21, how did holy men of God speak prophecy?
options: As they were moved by the Holy Ghost
By their own will and ideas
questions.correctAnswer: As they were moved by the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: Verse 21 teaches that prophecy was spoken by holy men under the movement of the Holy Spirit, affirming the doctrine of divine inspiration as in Hebrews 1:1-2 and John 16:13.

questions.question: What does 2 Peter 1:14 reveal about Peter's awareness of his impending death?
options: He knew he would shortly put off his tabernacle
He expected to live many more years
He was unaware of his future
He planned to retire from ministry
questions.correctAnswer: He knew he would shortly put off his tabernacle
questions.explanation: Verse 14 shows Peter’s awareness of his imminent death, using 'put off this my tabernacle' as a metaphor for dying. This aligns with Jesus’ foreknowledge of His death (John 13:1) and Paul's similar awareness (2 Timothy 4:6).
